pros: Amazing boss and atmosphere here
cons: low pay, no opportunity for higher pay

pros: Academic freedom and engaged students
cons: Severely underpaid and severely overworked

pros: Good amount of research funds available
cons: They laid off tenured profs and a bunch of staff just as I started

review_title: No work life balance, college in decline
pros: Nearby walking trails and surrounding Allegheny National Forest
cons: Salary, job, supervisors, workload, overcharging of students

review_title: Don’t go to this place as a minority.
pros: Quiet town, people are generally nice.
cons: Isolated, discrimination is prevalent, unpleasant

review_title: Talks a Great Talk, but Never Walks the Walk
pros: It's local in a town that isn't a college town. The students make the days bearable.
cons: Everything else. They underpay, overwork, expect you to use skills and do tasks not on your job description (and then add it later without updating your title or giving you a raise). They pile on more and more while adding budget cuts and eliminating positions. And this was even before their recent large scale elimination that impacted so many of my previous colleagues. They make you fight for any kind of title change, then deny requests for raises. Working there is a constant uphill battle for basic boundaries, and don't expect a work/life balance. They say they recommend self care and professional development in broad senses, but when they face individuals, they have a reason to deny/discourage both. They say they celebrate and welcome diversity but fail over and over to provide the infrastructure to support those communities. It's a gilded cage. Everything is pretty on the outside, including their words, but it's only surface deep.

review_title: Salary matches cost of living, but still not ideal for the standard
pros: Salary matches the cost of living in the area
cons: Salary is not in line with other salaries for similar jobs at other colleges

pros: Benefits, work flexibility, intelligent colleagues,
cons: Compensation, location, leadership, workload, other duties as assigned

job_title: Student Life Coordinator in Meadville, PA
pros: Housing provided, direct work with students, meal plan provided, remote location, flexible direct managers
cons: The office was chaotic & many behaviors were toxic, the structure of the position is too unclear, work load, communication, location

review_title: Not the greatest place to work
pros: Nice people, good work life balance
cons: Undervalued and underpaid. Cuts in benefits and staffing have made it a lot harder

pros: I don't care, I'm just trying to look at something
cons: Honestly, the only con I can see is this awful website that makes people submit personal information in order to just use the most basic aspects of the website

pros:
-Holiday vacations (2 full weeks off at Christmas)
-Access to campus facilities
-Great coworkers
cons:
-College has undergone many changes recently
-Salary is not competitve

job_title: Non Exempt Staff in Meadville, PA
pros:
Great community of people.
Faculty members are excellent and go above and beyond for their students.
It is a beautiful campus.
cons: The administration is top heavy and their decision making skills are sub-par. It used to be a great place to work, but now over 2/3 of the employees are administration compared to staff. Very VERY low pay.

pros: Overall good atmosphere and will receive a good education
cons: Tough class workload with poor communication from professors.

job_title: Football Team Video Camera Manager in Meadville, PA
pros: Job offered some time to study during non-recording times at practice. Also gave me the opportunity to get paid to watch/work at the football games. Would recommend.
cons: Practice times could start around 4:30 and run as late as 7:30. The team also arrives on campus a few weeks before classes start so I was required to attend. It does give you the chance to move in without the crazyness of move in day but it does take away from your summer at home.

pros: Health insurance benefits are decent
cons: No raises in years, cut matching funds to retirement in 2020/21, no salary base for positions (people starting with less education or experience could come in at a higher pay than you for the same job)

pros: Good team work and camaraderie
cons: Hilariously low pay for hilariously high expectations. 12 hour days not uncommon, and 5am alarms for college fairs and flights to more college fairs were the norm. Only 10 paid days off a year outside of holidays and it's a fight to even get to use those.

pros: Strong commitment to students and quality teaching.
cons: Diversity in the work environment and college location.

pros: This is a great place for students to supplement work along with their studies.
cons: Students should be able to choose the maximum amount of hours they want to work.

review_title: Working with students is more energizing than a cup of coffee!
pros: The reward of supporting students as they identify and achieve their goals.
cons: The work expands to fill whatever time you'll give it.

job_title: Adjunct College Professor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great colleagues and great students!
cons: There are none other than my commute from Pittsburgh.

job_title: Assistant Athletics Coach in Meadville, PA
pros: Adequate Athletic Facilities for DIII
cons: Not a tremendous work environment across the campus

pros: One of the best reasons is the great salary.
cons: The location is in an economically challenged area.

pros: Educational environments are great and Allegheny is no exception - 1/2 the stress of a corporate job. The salary is a little low but the benefits are great.
cons: Salaries tend to be on the low end.

review_title: It was good for a student
pros: Set schedule, had freedom to do other homework if no students showed up for tutoring
cons: pay was a bit low

pros: Liberal arts, small town, great area with farmers and clean water.
cons: Drama and cliches. Strange politics and behind-the-scenes scheming.

pros: It is a secure job.
cons: The work is located in an isolated place.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Slippery Rock, PA
pros: Great employees, good students, research support
cons: Location, lamp, grass, sky, Steven

review_title: It's a great place to work and work you will
pros:
Quality of life.  If you enjoy small town life and the great outdoors then Meadville is a great community.  I can get to work in a matter of minutes and be home equally quickly.  Working with dynamic, idealistic students keeps one young and in touch with what's current.

The college has been around for 200 years and won't be outsourced.  It's adapting to change and planning to weather another 200 years.

There are wonderful opportunities to attend gallery opennings, performances, lectures and sporting events at little or no cost.

My colleagues are some of the best people in the world!
cons:
As a member of the staff the hours and demands are often endless.

There is great financial support for faculty but not for staff and administration.

review_title: A hallmark of my college working life.
pros: If you are looking for a chance to learn more about politics, be engaged, and feel like you've made a difference on Allegheny College's campus, this is the place for you!
cons: It can be difficult to get in, especially as a fellow. But the center is currently in transition towards a new director. There are also times when the work can be a bit slow, or projects do not come in at a timely manner.

pros: Close Staff, everyone knows everyone, cheap area to live, opportunities for advancement in staff positions, People tend to care about their work, students are reliable and intelligent
cons: everyone knows everyone's business, set in a small town which can get a little claustrophobic, students can be entitled, parents can be overbearing, certain departments are underfunded and it shows,

review_title: A Start...but seems a stepping stone
pros: The students are overall pretty phenomenal, the presidential leadership is exemplary, the advising and support staff is far above excellent, strong and competitive benefits packages
cons: Lack of direction on diversity and equality with working beyond retention and student experience. Lack of progressive voices and policies to encourage diverse individuals to apply and stay at the institution. Speaks about diversity from one direction and then doesn't follow through with stated goals at the Faculty- administrative levels.

pros: Working here for admissions at Allegheny is a wonderful experience that is unprecedented towards another college.  The application to the real world is apparent and is a prized position through many interviews and courses.
cons: With no doubt, being a college student having the most strict work policies along with a the same wage as every other job on campus, is not satisfying.  Considering other jobs on campus have the same wage with no work skill, is unfair.

pros: Supervisors were flexible with hours and duties, office environmental was fast-paced yet very comfortable.  Part-time employment increased my data entry skills as well as my customer service skills.  I am confident that full-time employees have great opportunities to move up in the company.  Also, benefits and salary are competitive for full-time employees.
cons: As a student employee, wages were just above minimum.  Work load varied based on time of year.

pros: Lots of support, great team, fun work environment.  Getting time off was pretty easy and the people were understanding.  The compensation wasn't high but I loved what I was doing and who I was working with.
cons: My boss was great but some of the surrounding ones were not.  Some of the people my boss answered to were more caught up in their own agendas than actually good at doing their job.

review_title: Great opportunity, but is what you make of it
pros: This job gives you a rare opportunity to practice walking that thin line between peer and mentor -- something that is incredibly difficult, but a necessary component of life.
cons: This is unavoidable, but you will have to be responsible for grown adults who should be responsible for themselves. As a result, I think a lot of people get burnt out doing this kind of work.

pros: A few nice people and the pay was okay for a new professional.
cons: Poor leadership, unclear policies, offices didn't want to work together - no community feel. People were promoted (long before I was hired) into positions they are not qualified for lending itself to poor office mission, direction, and leadership. In transition, work will be piled on you without any compensation. Very Very poor work/life balance - there is no opportunity to advocate for yourself in this regard. Meadville is a pretty small town with little to offer.

review_title: Working as as tour guide has been one of the most enjoyable and productive experiences I've had at Allegheny.
pros: Flexibility in terms of hours, interaction with peers is enjoyable, working with prospective students/families is rewarding
cons: Being promoted to a Student Assistant or Intern can be competitive, and sometimes I feel like my efforts go unnoticed.

pros: Colleagues are very helpful and welcoming. You have the opportunity of mentoring college students that are open to learning.
cons: excessive work hours, working hourly is a better call. The job needs a desperate balance of work and personal life.

job_title: Financial Aid Assistant in Meadville, PA
pros: Staff was amazing - hours were flexible. There were always opportunities to work extra hours if you were doing your job well.
cons: There is a lot of paper work. Some people struggled to stay organized and that did not make management happy.

review_title: One of the best employers in the area.
pros: Community of like minded individuals. Involvement opportunities. Enrichment opportunities. Educational opportunities. Community service a high priority. Highly recommend working here.
cons: I have found no cons working here, colleagues are congenial and respectful, cultural experiences abound, workplace involvement is campus-wide and encouraged.

pros: This is a collaborative team and one of the best groups I've ever worked with. It offers great development opportunities and has a strong network of past employees
cons: *none, it's a great place to work all around

review_title: Allegheny College has taught me lessons that couldn't be learned in a classroom or a book.
pros: It is a strong academic school. There is an resource for everything and somebody willing to help you.
cons: Short retention rate of employees within 5 years of employment specifically professors.

pros: Great supervisors who took great interest in my academic future (I was a student worker) and maintained flexibility for me.
cons: I would have liked greater structure at certain points in my academic career, but overall I have very little negative to say.

review_title: Overall a wonderful place to work in school
pros:
Flexible supervisors
Leadership opportunities
Realize you're a student first
cons: Overly political message but that's what the school stands for not Admissions

review_title: I learned a lot working at my Alma Mater
job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Meadville, PA
pros:
Offers a wonderful education and it's a pleasure to help students find their way to it. 
Close knit community
cons: Small town life is difficult for singles

pros: Very laid back but very time oriented. Know how to have fun while getting work done.
cons: late nights and some weekends

pros: The work study program was well planned and smoothly operated around school work.
cons: Only work study positions are offered.

pros:
- Great work environment
- Time for Homework
cons: - Certain days consist of repetitive, rote tasks

job_title: Professor Of English in Meadville, PA
pros: Yes, for sure, I suppose.
cons: Even more in this realm, for sure.
